Afghanistan:
Afghanistan declared war on Persia.
Afghan forces re-captured Herat.
Australia:
Victorian Committee reported that a 'federal union' would be in the interests of all the growing colonies. However, there was not enough interest in or enthusiasm for taking positive steps towards bringing the colonies together.
Victorian men achieved the right to vote.
Bangladesh: Indian Rebellion of 1857 also known as the Sepoy Mutiny/ Indian Mutiny breaks out.
Belgium:
Charles Rogier replaces Pierre de Decker as Prime Minister
Belgian general election, 1857
Chile: The Civil Code of Chile comes into effect; it will become a model for Latin American legal codes down to the present day.
Colombia: The Law of 15 June 1857, created the other states that would go on to form the Granadine Confederation: The Sovereign State of Bolívar, The Sovereign State of Santander, The Sovereign State of Cauca, and The Sovereign State of Magdalena
India:
British victory in Indian Rebellion of 1857.

Last Mughal Emperor Bahadur Shah Zafar was deposed by British East India Company and India transferred to British Crown.

India's first three universities, the University of Mumbai, the University of Madras and the University of Calcutta, are established.
Mexico:
• The Federal Constitution of the United Mexican States of 1857 goes into effect.
  • The Reform War begins when the Plan of Tacubaya is proclaimed and conservative General Félix María Zuloaga ousts president Ignacio Comonfort.
Nepal: Sepoy Rebellion waged against British in north India; Nepal aids British (to 1858)
Philippine: Fernándo Norzagaray y Escudero appointed Governor-General (1857–1860)
Russia: The last military settlements were disbanded.
Slovenia:
The "Carinthian railway" between Maribor and Klagenfurt is being built.
The "Southern Railway" is completed and opened.
Tanzania: British explorers Richard Burton and John Speke travel from Zanzibar to the East African coast and begin their exploration of continental East Africa.
